exclusive_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesCreateRequestBodyExclusiveCategories
exclusive_categories.description: Lists the IDs of exclusive categories. A redeemable from a campaign with an exclusive category is the only redeemable to be redeemed when applied with redeemables from other campaigns unless these campaigns are exclusive or joint.

joint_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesCreateRequestBodyJointCategories
joint_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the joint categories. A campaign with a joint category is always applied regardless of the exclusivity of other campaigns.

redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables can be sent in one request. Note: more redeemables means more processing time.

applicable_redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables can be applied in one request. The number must be less than or equal to `redeemables_limit`. For example, a user can select 30 discounts but only 5 will be applied to the order and the remaining will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_redeemables_per_category_limi.description: Defines how many redeemables with the same category can be applied in one request. The number must be less than or equal to `applicable_redeemables_limit`. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables with an assigned exclusive category can be applied in one request. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_exclusive_redeemables_per_cat.description: Defines how many redeemables with an assigned exclusive category can be applied in one request. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`. The number must be less than or equal to `applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit`.

discount_calculation_mode.description: Defines if the discounts are applied by taking into account the initial order amount or the discounted order amount.

initial_amount_mode_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesCreateRequestBodyInitialAmountModeCategories
initial_amount_mode_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the categories that apply a discount based on the initial amount.

discounted_amount_mode_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesCreateRequestBodyDiscountedAmountModeCategories
discounted_amount_mode_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the categories that apply a discount based on the discounted amount.

redeemables_application_mode.description:
Defines the application mode for redeemables.
`"ALL"` means that all redeemables must be validated for the redemption to be successful.
`"PARTIAL"` means that only those redeemables that can be validated will be redeemed. The redeemables that fail validaton will be skipped.

redeemables_sorting_rule.description: Defines redeemables sorting rule. `CATEGORY_HIERARCHY` means that redeemables are applied oaccording to the category priority. `REQUESTED_ORDER` means that redeemables are applied in the sequence provided in the request.

redeemables_products_application_mode.description: Defines redeemables products application mode. `STACK` means that multiple discounts can be applied to a product. `ONCE` means that only one discount can be applied to the same product.

redeemables_no_effect_rule.description: Defines redeemables no effect rule. `REDEEM_ANYWAY` means that the redeemable will be redeemed regardless of any restrictions or conditions in place. `SKIP` means that the redeemable will be processed only when an applicable effect is calculated.

no_effect_skip_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesCreateRequestBodyNoEffectSkipCategories
no_effect_skip_categories.description: Lists category IDs. Redeemables with a given category are skipped even if the `redeemables_no_effect_rule` is set to `REDEEM_ANYWAY`. Category IDs can't overlap with the IDs in `no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories`.

no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesCreateRequestBodyNoEffectRedeemAnywayCategories
no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories.description: Lists category IDs. Redeemables with a given category are redeemed anyway even if the `redeemables_no_effect_rule` is set to `SKIP`. Category IDs can't overlap with the IDs in `no_effect_skip_categories`.

redeemables_rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values.

id.description: The unique identifier of the stacking rules.

data.description: Dictionary that contains an array of campaign templates.

total.description: Total number of templates, regardless of the applied query parameters. Displayed only if the `include_total` query paremeter is set to `true`.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates if there are more records for given filter parameters. This lets you know if you can run another request to get more records returned in the results.

more_starting_after.description: Returns an ID that can be used to return another page of results. Use the template ID in the `starting_after_id` query parameter to display another page of the results starting after the template with that ID.

description.description: A user-defined description of the project, e.g. its purpose, scope, region.

timezone.description: The time zone in which the project is established. It can be in the GMT format or in accordance with IANA time zone database.

currency.description: The currency used in the project. It is equal to a 3-letter ISO 4217 code.

dial_code.description: The country dial code for the project. It is equal to an ITU country code.

webhook_version.description: The webhook version used in the project.

client_loyalty_events_enabled.description: Enables client-side events for loyalty and referral programs.

client_set_voucher_expiration_date_enabl.description: Enables client-side setting of voucher expiration date.

webhook_version.description: The webhook version used in the project.

client_trusted_domains.description: An array of URL addresses that allow client requests.

client_loyalty_events_enabled.description: Enables client-side events for loyalty and referral programs.

client_set_voucher_expiration_date_enabl.description: Enables client-side setting of voucher expiration date.

webhooks_callout_notifications.title: ManagementProjectsUpdateResponseBodyWebhooksCalloutNotifications
webhooks_callout_notifications.description: Determines the notification settings for webhook callouts configured in Distributions and Project settings.

distributions.title: ManagementProjectsUpdateResponseBodyWebhooksCalloutNotificationsDistributions

in_app.description: Enables the notification through an email.

webhooks.title: ManagementProjectsUpdateResponseBodyWebhooksCalloutNotificationsWebhooks

email.description: Enables the notification through an email.

in_app.description: Enables the notification through an email.

emails.title: ManagementProjectsUpdateResponseBodyWebhooksCalloutNotificationsWebhooksEmails
emails.description: An array of email addresses which will receive the notification.

cluster_id.description: The identifier of the cluster where the project will be created.

case_sensitive_codes.description:
Determines if the vouchers in the project will be:
- case sensitive - if `true`, `C0dE-cfV` is **not** equal to `c0de-cfv`),
- case insensitive - if `false`, `C0dE-cfV` is equal to `c0de-cfv`.

api_version.description: The API version used in the project. Currently, the default and only value is `v2018-08-01`.

is_sandbox.description: Determines if the project is a sandbox project.

default_code_config.title: ManagementProjectsUpdateResponseBodyDefaultCodeConfig
default_code_config.description: Determines the character set that is used as default for vouchers. It is affected by the `"case_sensitive_codes"` setting.

charset.description: Lists all characters that are used as default for vouchers

limits.title: ManagementProjectsUpdateResponseBodyLimits
limits.description: Determines additional limits set on a given project, e.g. the Sandbox project. If no limits are returned, the limits set for the whole organization apply.

items.title: ManagementProjectsUpdateResponseBodyLimitsApiCallsItem
items.description: Determines the limit of API calls per given unit time.

value.description: Determines the maximum number of API calls per time set in `"duration"`.

duration.description: Determines the amount of time during which the calls up to the number specified in the `value` can be made. The duration is presented in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. `PT1H` means one hour.

value.description: Determines the maximum number of API calls per time set in `"duration"`.

duration.description: Determines the amount of time during which the calls up to the number specified in the `value` can be made. The duration is presented in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. `PT1H` means one hour.

id.description:
The unique identifier of the user who will be assigned to the project. It can be found in Team Settings > Team > Edit member. **Required** with the `role` string.

Do **not** use with the `login` string.

login.description:
The login data of the user who will be assigned to the project. **Required** with the `role` string.

Do **not** use with the `id` string.

role.description:
The role of the user to be added. It can be one of the following predefined roles:
`ADMIN`, `USER`, `VIEWER`, `MERCHANT`,
or an ID of a custom role.

projects.title: ManagementProjectsUsersInviteCreateRequestBodyProjects
projects.description: In the key, provide the project ID to which the new user will be assigned. In the value, provide the role which the user will have in the project. The predefined Voucherify roles are: `ADMIN`, `USER`, `VIEWER`, `MERCHANT`, `USER_RESTRICTED` (for the Areas and Stores, an Enterprise feature). Send a custom role ID (Enterprise feature) to assign a custom role. To find the custom role ID: If you are an admin, go to Voucherify Dashboard, Team settings, and Roles tab. Click on a custom role. The custom role ID is in the URL in the format `role_XyZ7aB9cD2eF4gH1iJ0kL5mN6oP8qR3s`.

related_object.description: The resource type. You can define custom metadata schemas, which have a custom `"related_object"` resource type. The standard metadata schemas are: `"campaign"`, `"customer"`, `"earning_rule"`, `"loyalty_tier"`, `"order"`, `"order_item"`, `"product"`, `"promotion_tier"`, `"publication"`, `"redemption"`, `"reward"`, `"voucher"`.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the metadata schema was updated. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items.title: OrdersCreateRequestBodyItems
items.description: Array of items applied to the order. It can include up to 500 items.

metadata.title: OrdersCreateRequestBodyMetadata
metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format. It can be used to define business validation rules or discount formulas.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

referrer_id.description: Unique referrer ID.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

initial_amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts before any discount or other effect (e.g. add missing units) is applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_amount.description: Order amount after undoing all the discounts through the rollback redemption. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

metadata.title: PromotionsTiersCreateRequestBodyMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

category.description: Assign a new or update the promotion tier's category using name.

category_id.description: Assign a new or update the promotion tier's category using id

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` using the <!-- [Disable Campaign](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1campaigns~1{campaignId}~1disable) -->[Disable Campaign](ref:disable-campaign) endpoint.

failure_code.description: Generic reason as to why the create publication operation failed.

failure_message.description: This parameter will provide more expanded reason as to why the create publication operation failed.

total.description: Total number of publications.

scenario.description:
Defines the scenario Voucherify should consider during the qualification process.

- `ALL` - Scenario that returns all redeemables available for the customer in one API request. This scenario is used by default when no value is selected.
- `CUSTOMER_WALLET` - returns vouchers applicable to the customer's cart based on the vouchers assigned to the customer's profile.
- `AUDIENCE_ONLY` - returns all vouchers, promotion tiers, and campaigns available to the customer. Voucherify validates the rules based on the customer profile only.
- `PRODUCTS` - returns all promotions available for the products (when a discount is defined to be applied to the item or when the item is required in the validation rule).
- `PRODUCTS_DISCOUNT` - returns all promotions available for products when a discount is defined as applicable to specific item(s).
- `PROMOTION_STACKS` - returns the applicable promotion stacks.
- `PRODUCTS_BY_CUSTOMER` - returns all promotions available for a customer for the products (when a discount is defined to be applied to the item or when the item is required in the validation rule).
- `PRODUCTS_DISCOUNT_BY_CUSTOMER` - returns all promotions available for a customer for products when a discount is defined as applicable to specific item(s).

session.title: QualificationsCheckEligibilityRequestBodySession
session.description: Parameter to return details about `locked_credits` on a gift card which has locked credits under a validation session.

type.description: Parameter required to return the details about the `locked_credits`.

metadata.title: QualificationsCheckEligibilityRequestBodyMetadata
metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against redeemables requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

tracking_id.description: This identifier is generated during voucher qualification based on your internal id (e.g., email, database ID). This is a hashed customer source ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.title: RedemptionsGetResponseBodyMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the redemption.

amount.description:
For gift cards, this is a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the number of redeemed credits.
For loyalty cards, this is the number of loyalty points used in the transaction. and For gift cards, this represents the number of the credits restored to the card in the rolledback redemption. The number is a negative integer in the smallest currency unit, e.g. -100 cents for $1.00 added back to the card.
For loyalty cards, this represents the number of loyalty points restored to the card in the rolledback redemption. The number is a negative integer.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption.

session.title: RedemptionsGetResponseBodySession
session.description: Contains details about the redemption session lock. Sessions can be established only for discount vouchers, promotions, and gift cards.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID sent in the request.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values. This is returned only in GET `v1/redemptions/` and GET `v1/redemptions/{redemptionId}` endpoints.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a more expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

initial_amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts before any discount or other effect (e.g. add missing units) is applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_amount.description: Order amount after undoing all the discounts through the rollback redemption. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

amount.description: Amount subtracted from the gift card as a result of the redemption. The amount is expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00). and Amount returned to the gift card as a result of the redemption rollback and expressed as a negative integer. The amount is expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. -100 cents for $1.00 returned).

points.description: Number of points subtracted from the loyalty card as a result of the redemption. and Number of points being returned to the loyalty card for the reward redemption rollback. It is expressed as a negative integer.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

metadata.title: RedemptionsListResponseBodyRedemptionsItemMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the redemption.

amount.description:
For gift cards, this is a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the number of redeemed credits.
For loyalty cards, this is the number of loyalty points used in the transaction. and For gift cards, this represents the number of the credits restored to the card in the rolledback redemption. The number is a negative integer in the smallest currency unit, e.g. -100 cents for $1.00 added back to the card.
For loyalty cards, this represents the number of loyalty points restored to the card in the rolledback redemption. The number is a negative integer.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption.

session.title: RedemptionsListResponseBodyRedemptionsItemSession
session.description: Contains details about the redemption session lock. Sessions can be established only for discount vouchers, promotions, and gift cards.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID sent in the request.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values. This is returned only in GET `v1/redemptions/` and GET `v1/redemptions/{redemptionId}` endpoints.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a more expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

initial_amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts before any discount or other effect (e.g. add missing units) is applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_amount.description: Order amount after undoing all the discounts through the rollback redemption. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

id.description: Unique campaign ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` using the <!-- [Disable Campaign](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1campaigns~1{campaignId}~1disable) -->[Disable Campaign](ref:disable-campaign) endpoint.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

campaign_id.description: Promotion tier's parent campaign's unique ID.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

total_redeemed.description: Number of times the promotion tier was redeemed.

total_amount.description: Sum of order totals.

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of total discount applied using the promotion tier.

The amount is expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00). and Amount returned to the gift card as a result of the redemption rollback and expressed as a negative integer. The amount is expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. -100 cents for $1.00 returned).

points.description: Number of points subtracted from the loyalty card as a result of the redemption. and Number of points being returned to the loyalty card for the reward redemption rollback. It is expressed as a negative integer.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

expand.title: RedemptionsRedeemRequestBodyOptionsExpand
expand.description:
Expand array lets you configure params included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. | **Expand Option** | **Response Body** | |:---|:---| | ["order"] | - Same response as fallback response (without an options object).
- Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Metadata not included for each discount type. | | ["redeemable"] | Expands redeemable objects by including `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["order", "redeemable"] | - Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Includes `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["redeemable", "redemption", "category"] | - Returns each discount type's `metadata` in each child redemption object.
- Returns redemption object `metadata`.
- Returns an expanded `categories` object, showing details about the category. |

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the SKU was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

async_action_id.description: The ID of the scheduled asynchronous action.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation or if the campaign consists of generic (standalone) voucherss.

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once. For loyalty campaigns, it's forced to `true`, even if `join_once: false` is passed in the request.

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign (size of campaign).

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the vouchers will be active after publishing. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with the value of P24D will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to. Either pass this parameter OR the `category`.

category.description: The category assigned to the campaign. Either pass this parameter OR the `category_id`.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

id.description: Unique validation rule ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the validation rule was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the validation rule was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

assignments_count.description: The number of instances the validation rule has been assigned to different types of redeemables.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the validation rule.

options.title: ValidationsValidateRequestBodyOptions
options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.title: ValidationsValidateRequestBodyOptionsExpand
expand.description:
The expand array lets you configure the parameters included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. | **Expand Option** | **Response Body** | |:---|:---| | ["order"] | - Same response as fallback response (without an options object).
- Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Metadata not included for each discount type. | | ["redeemable"] | Expands redeemable objects by including `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["order", "redeemable"] | - Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Includes `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["category"] | - Returns an expanded `categories` object, showing details about the category. |

gift.title: ValidationsValidateRequestBodyRedeemablesItemGift
gift.description: Contains information on the number of gift card credits that the customer wants to apply to the order.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfill the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

reward.title: ValidationsValidateRequestBodyRedeemablesItemReward
reward.description: Contains information about the reward that the customer wants to redeem and the number of points the customer is choosing to use for the reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID assigned by Voucherify. The reward must be assigned to the campaign in order for the user to be able to use the reward.

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to spend in order to fulfill the order using a **pay with points** reward. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card.

metadata.title: ValidationsValidateRequestBodyMetadata
metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a redemption object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the redemption in a structured format.

id.description: Unique identifier of the validation, assigned by Voucherify.

valid.description: The result of the validation. It takes all of the redeemables into account and returns a `false` if at least one redeemable is inapplicable. Returns `true` if all redeemables are applicable.

id.description: Redeemable ID, i.e. the voucher code.

object.description: Redeemable's object type.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product's source ID.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

gift.title: ValidationsValidateResponseBodyRedeemablesItemResultGift
gift.description: Stores the amount of gift card credits to be applied.

balance.description: Available funds at the moment of validation. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

credits.description: Total number of gift card credits to be applied. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

loyalty_card.title: ValidationsValidateResponseBodyRedeemablesItemResultLoyaltyCard
loyalty_card.description: Stores the amount of loyalty card points to be applied in the redemption.

points.description: Total number of loyalty points to be applied in the redemption.

metadata.title: ValidationsValidateResponseBodyRedeemablesItemMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redeemable.

campaign_name.description: Campaign name. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID assigned by Voucherify. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

name.description: Name of the promotion tier. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

skipped_redeemables.title: ValidationsValidateResponseBodySkippedRedeemables
skipped_redeemables.description: Lists validation results of each skipped redeemable.

inapplicable_redeemables.title: ValidationsValidateResponseBodyInapplicableRedeemables
inapplicable_redeemables.description: Lists validation results of each inapplicable redeemable.

amount.description: The incremental amount to be added to or removed from the current balance on the gift card or loyalty card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`. To remove balance, simply add a minus sign before the value, i.e. to remove $20, use -2000.

source_id.description: The merchant's transaction ID if it is different from the Voucherify transaction ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a transaction ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

amount.description: The incremental amount added (positive integer) or subtracted (negative integer) to the current balance on the gift card or loyalty card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

total.description: Total income incurred over the lifespan of the gift card or loyalty card.

balance.description: The balance after adding or subtracting a specified amount. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

type.description: The type of voucher being modified.

operation_type.description: The type of the operation being performed.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `balance`.

related_object.title: VouchersBalanceUpdateResponseBodyRelatedObject
related_object.description: Defines the resource that is being modified with the values that are returned in the balance object.

type.description: The object being modified, i.e. `voucher`.

id.description: Identifies the voucher that is being modified, this is the ID that was assigned by the Voucherify API.

code.description: Code that identifies a voucher. The pattern can use all the letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters. Pass this attribute in the request body to create a distinct code. Otherwise, either use the `code_config` object to set the rules that the Voucherify API will use to create a random code, or don't pass any code and Voucherify will generate a random code.

campaign.description: Identifies the voucher's parent campaign using a unique campaign name.

campaign_id.description: Identifies the voucher's parent campaign using a unique campaign ID assigned by the Voucherify API.

category.description: The name of the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers with the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique identifier assigned by Voucherify to the name of the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers with the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.title: VouchersCreateRequestBodyMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

validation_rules.title: VouchersCreateRequestBodyValidationRules
validation_rules.description: Array containing the ID of the validation rule associated with the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.title: VouchersCreateResponseBodyGift
gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.title: VouchersCreateResponseBodyLoyaltyCard
loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the redeemable holder. It equals to the customer ID assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referring person.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

publish.title: VouchersCreateResponseBodyPublish
publish.description: Stores a summary of publication events: an event counter and endpoint to return details of each event. Publication is an assignment of a code to a customer, e.g. through a distribution.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

redemption.title: VouchersCreateResponseBodyRedemption
redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.title: VouchersGetResponseBodyGift
gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.title: VouchersGetResponseBodyLoyaltyCard
loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

more_starting_after.description: Returns an ID that can be used to return another page of results. Use the transaction ID in the `starting_after_id` query parameter to display another page of the results starting after the transaction with that ID.
