AccessSettings.title: AccessSettings
AccessSettings.description:
Assigns or unassigns an area or store to the campaign.

**NOTE**: this object can be sent if the Areas and Stores enterprise feature is enabled. Contact [Voucherify Sales](https://www.voucherify.io/contact-sales) to learn more.

assign.title: AccessSettingsAssign
assign.description:
Assigns the campaign to an area or a store. Provide the area and/or store IDs in the respective arrays. If a campaign changes assignments between areas or stores, unassign it from the area. For example, if a campaign is assigned to Area-01, but it must be now assigned to Store-01 within this area, you have to unassign the campaign from Area-01 and assign to Store-01 only.

If you want to assign the campaign to stores only, you do not have to send the area ID.

areas_ids.title: AccessSettingsAssignAreasIds
areas_ids.description: List all area IDs to which the campaign will be assigned.

area_stores_ids.title: AccessSettingsAssignAreaStoresIds
area_stores_ids.description: List all store IDs to which the campaign will be assigned.

area_all_stores_ids.title: AccessSettingsAssignAreaAllStoresIds
area_all_stores_ids.description: List all area IDs where the campaign is assigned to all stores in the area. This assignment is not equal to the assignment to all `area_stores_ids` listed separately.

unassign.title: AccessSettingsUnassign
unassign.description:
Unassigns the campaign from an area or a store. Provide the area and/or store IDs in the respective arrays. If a campaign changes assignments between areas or stores, unassign it first. For example, if a campaign is assigned to Area-01, but it must be now assigned to Store-01 within this area, you have to unassign the campaign from Area-01 and assigned to Store-01 only.

If you want to assign the campaign to stores only, you do not have to send the area ID.

areas_ids.title: AccessSettingsUnassignAreasIds
areas_ids.description: List all area IDs from which the campaign will be unassigned.

area_stores_ids.title: AccessSettingsUnassignAreaStoresIds
area_stores_ids.description: List all store IDs from which the campaign will be unassigned.

area_all_stores_ids.title: AccessSettingsUnassignAreaAllStoresIds
area_all_stores_ids.description: List all area IDs where the campaign will be unassigned from all stores in the area. This unassignment is not equal to the unassignment from all `area_stores_ids` listed separately.

AccessSettingsCampaignAssignmentsList.title: AccessSettingsCampaignAssignmentsList
AccessSettingsCampaignAssignmentsList.description:
Lists all assignments of the campaign to areas and stores. For [GET List Campaigns](ref:list-campaigns), this is returned if the `expand=access_settings_assignments` query parameter is passed in the request. This object is not returned for the [GET Campaign summary endpoint](ref:get-campaign-summary).

**NOTE**: This object is returned only if the Areas and Stores enterprise feature is enabled. Contact [Voucherify Sales](https://www.voucherify.io/contact-sales) to learn more.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `list`. This object stores information about campaign assignments to areas and stores

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of campaign assignments.

data.title: AccessSettingsCampaignAssignmentsListData
data.description: Contains an array of campaign assignments.

total.description: Total number of areas and stores to which the campaign is assigned.

object.description: This object stores information about the resource to which the discount is applicable.

id.description: Unique product collection, product, or SKU identifier assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The source identifier from your inventory system.

product_id.description: Parent product's unique ID assigned by Voucherify.

product_source_id.description: Parent product's source ID from your inventory system.

price.description: New fixed price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 price is written as 1000. In case of the fixed price being calculated by the formula, i.e. the price_formula parameter is present in the fixed price definition, this value becomes the fallback value. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed price.

price_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item.

quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted per order line item.

aggregated_quantity_limit.description: The maximum number of units allowed to be discounted combined across all matched order line items.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount per order line item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

aggregated_amount_limit.description:
Maximum discount amount per order. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount on the entire order is written as 600. This value is definable for the following discount effects:
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS` (each item subtotal is discounted equally)
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS_BY_QUANTITY` (each unit of matched products has the same discount value)

order_item_indices.title: ApplicableToOrderItemIndices
order_item_indices.description: Lists which order lines are (not) covered by the discount. The order in the array is determined by the sequence of applied discounts, while the numbers correspond to the order lines sent in the `order` object in the request. The first order line is assigned `0`, the second order line is assigned `1`, and so on.

order_item_units.title: ApplicableToOrderItemUnits
order_item_units.description: Lists which units within order lines are covered by the discount. The order line items are listed according to sequence of applied discounts while the `index` corresponds to the order line sent in the `order` object in the request.

index.description: Number assigned to the order line item in accordance with the order sent in the request.

units.title: ApplicableToOrderItemUnitsItemUnits
units.description: Numbers of units in the order line covered by the discount; e.g. `2, 5, 8` for 10 units with the setting `"skip_initially": 1`, `"repeat": 3`. The counting of units starts from `1`. The maximum quantity of all handled units is 1000. If the quantity of all order items exceeds 1000, this array is not returned, but `units_limit_exceeded: true`. However, the discount is calculated properly for all relevant units.

units_limit_exceeded.description: Returned as `true` only when the sum total of `quantity` of all order items exceeds 1000.

repeat.description: Determines the recurrence of the discount, e.g. `"repeat": 3` means that the discount is applied to every third item.

skip_initially.description: Determines how many items are skipped before the discount is applied.

target.description: Determines to which kinds of objects the discount is applicable. `ITEM` includes products and SKUs. `UNIT` means particular units within an order line.

data.title: ApplicableToResultListData
data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount can apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining included products, SKUs, or product collections.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

data_ref.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

ApplicationDetails.title: ApplicationDetails
ApplicationDetails.description: Array containing details about the items that are replaced and the items that are replacements for discounts with the `REPLACE_ITEMS` effect.

items.title: ApplicationDetailsItem
items.description: Object representing item replacement.

source_index.description: Index number of the source item that is replaced. The enumeration starts from `0`, which represents the first item in the request, e.g., if the replaced item is passed as the second in the request, `source_index` equals `3`.

source_applied_quantity.description: Number of source units that are replaced.

source_applied_quantity_amount.description: Amount equal to the price of the units that are replaced. Determines the change of the amount of the source item quantity.

target_index.description: Index number of the target item that is a replacement of the source item. The enumeration continues the values for the order items, e.g. if there are three items in the request, `target_index` equals `3`, as enumeration starts from `0`.

target_applied_quantity.description: Number of added target units that are replacements.

target_applied_quantity_amount.description: Amount equal to the price of the units that are replacements. Determines the change in the amount of the target item quantity.

target_applied_discount_amount.description: Discount amount applied to the target item with regard to the replacement. Equals the `target_applied_quantity_amount` minus `source_applied_quantity_amount`.

AsyncActionBase.title: AsyncActionBase
AsyncActionBase.description: This is an object representing an asynchronous action.

id.description: Async action unique ID.

type.description: Type of async action.

status.description: Status of the async action. Informs you whether the async action has already been completed.

operation_status.description: Status of async action processing. Informs about the async action status, whether it failed, succeeded, or the status is unknown.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the async action was scheduled in ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the async action was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

processing_time.description: The length of time it took to process the request in milliseconds.

progress.description: % progress to completion of the asynchronous action.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `async_action`.

Bundle.title: Bundle
Bundle.description: Determines how the bundle conditions are met by the customer's order items. The items in the order meet the bundle condition in the following way: SKU, then product, then collection.

quantity.description: Determines how many bundles are qualified. If there are missing bundle products, the value is `0`. If the bundle is qualified, the value is `1`. The maximum number of identified bundles can equal the number set in `limit`. Also defines the multiplier of the discount for `AMOUNT`, `PERCENT`, and `UNIT` discount types. To inform end-customers that more products can be added to meet additional bundles, compare this parameter with `limit`.

limit.description: Determines the maximum number of identified bundles. This also defines the maximum multiplier of the bundle discount.

identified.title: BundleIdentified
identified.description: Determines products from the customer's order items that meet bundle conditions. SKUs meet the conditions for their product that is used in the bundle. Returns only the products and their quantity that meet the bundle.

items.title: BundleIdentifiedItem
items.description: Determines a product from the customer's order items that meets bundle conditions.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product or SKU that meets the bundle condition. This is an ID assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: Determines the type of the object that meets the bundle condition.

item_index.description: Number assigned to the order line item in accordance with the order sent in the request. It starts with `0` for the first order line item in the request.

item_quantity.description: Quantity of items that meet the bundle conditions. If the quantity in the order is higher than the quantity required by the bundle, this returns only the number that meets the bundle. For example, if the bundle requires `5` coffees, but the order includes `10` coffees, `item_quantity` returns `5`.

missing.title: BundleMissing
missing.description: Determines products, SKUs, or collections from the bundle that are missing in the customer's order items. Determines also the missing quantity. For collections, this means that order items do not include a sufficient number of items that belong to the collection. Not returned when all required bundle items are in the order.

items.title: BundleMissingItem
items.description: Determines a product, SKU, or collection that is in bundle conditions, but is missing in the customer's order items. Determines also the missing quantity.

id.description: Unique identifier of the collection, product, or SKU that is missing in the customer's order items. This is an ID assigned by Voucherify.

object.description: Determines the type of the object that is missing in the customer's order items.

item_quantity.description: Quantity of items that are missing in the order items to meet the bundle conditions.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation or if the campaign consists of generic (standalone) voucherss.

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published
- `STANDALONE`: campaign for single vouchers

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once. It is always `false` for generic (standalone) vouchers campaigns and it cannot be changed in them. It is always `true` for loyalty campaigns and it cannot be changed in them.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the vouchers will be active after publishing. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with the value of P24D will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.title: CampaignMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

category.description: Unique category name.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's voucher generation.

readonly.description: Indicates whether the campaign can be only read by a restricted user in the Areas and Stores enterprise feature. It is returned only to restricted users; this field is not returned for users with other roles. It is also not returned for restricted users who use the [GET Campaign summary](ref:campaign-summary) endpoint.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

categories.title: CampaignCategories
categories.description: Contains details about the campaign category. For the GET [List campaigns](ref:list-campaigns) endpoint, this is returned only if the `expand=category` query parameter is passed in the request. Otherwise, it is returned as an empty array. For GET [Campaign summary](ref:get-campaign-summary) endpoint, it is always returned as an empty array.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

CampaignBase.title: CampaignBase
CampaignBase.description: This is an object representing a campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation or if the campaign consists of generic (standalone) voucherss.

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published
- `STANDALONE`: campaign for single vouchers

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once. It is always `false` for generic (standalone) vouchers campaigns and it cannot be changed in them. It is always `true` for loyalty campaigns and it cannot be changed in them.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the vouchers will be active after publishing. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with the value of P24D will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.title: CampaignBaseMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

category.description: Unique category name.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's voucher generation.

readonly.description: Indicates whether the campaign can be only read by a restricted user in the Areas and Stores enterprise feature. It is returned only to restricted users; this field is not returned for users with other roles. It is also not returned for restricted users who use the [GET Campaign summary](ref:campaign-summary) endpoint.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

categories.title: CampaignBaseCategories
categories.description: Contains details about the campaign category. For the GET [List campaigns](ref:list-campaigns) endpoint, this is returned only if the `expand=category` query parameter is passed in the request. Otherwise, it is returned as an empty array. For GET [Campaign summary](ref:get-campaign-summary) endpoint, it is always returned as an empty array.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

CampaignLoyaltyCard.title: CampaignLoyaltyCard
CampaignLoyaltyCard.description: Schema model for a campaign loyalty card.

points.description: The initial number of points to assign to the loyalty card. This is the current loyalty card score i.e. the number of loyalty points on the card.

expiration_rules.title: CampaignLoyaltyCardExpirationRules
expiration_rules.description: Defines the loyalty point expiration rule. This expiration rule applies when there are no `expiration_rules` defined for an earning rule.

period_type.description: Type of period. Can be set for `MONTH` or `FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`. `MONTH` requires the `period_value` field. `FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR` requires the `fixed_month` and `fixed_day` fields.

period_value.description: Value of the period. Required for the `period_type: MONTH`.

rounding_type.description: Type of rounding of the expiration period. Optional for the `period_type: MONTH`.

rounding_value.description: Value of rounding of the expiration period. Required for the `rounding_type`.

fixed_month.description: Determines the month when the points expire; `1` is January, `2` is February, and so on. Required for the `period_type: FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`.

fixed_day.description: Determines the day of the month when the points expire. Required for the `period_type: FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`.

CampaignLoyaltyVoucher.title: CampaignLoyaltyVoucher
CampaignLoyaltyVoucher.description: Schema model for a discount voucher.

type.description: Type of voucher.

redemption.title: CampaignLoyaltyVoucherRedemption
redemption.description: Defines the redemption limits on vouchers.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign template. It is assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the campaign template.

description.description: User-defined description of the campaign template.

campaign_type.description: Type of the campaign used to create the campaign template. Templates created from a promotion tier are converted to `DISCOUNT_COUPONS`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign template was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign template was last updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

CampaignVoucher.title: CampaignVoucher
CampaignVoucher.description: Schema model for a campaign voucher.

type.description: Type of voucher.

redemption.title: CampaignVoucherRedemption
redemption.description: Defines the redemption limits on vouchers.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

code.description: Value representing the imported code.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

metadata.title: CampaignsImportVoucherItemMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

start_date.description:
Activation timestamp presented in the ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date. Start date defines when the code starts to be active.
Allowed date formats are:
- YYYY-MM-DD
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ

expiration_date.description:
Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.
Allowed date formats are:
- YYYY-MM-DD
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: This is an object representing a category.

id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

hierarchy.description: Category hierarchy. Categories with lower hierarchy are processed before categories with higher hierarchy value.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the category.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

hierarchy.description: Category hierarchy. Categories with lower hierarchy are processed before categories with higher hierarchy value.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the category.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the category was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

stacking_rules_type.description: The type of the stacking rule eligibility.

CodeConfig.title: CodeConfig
CodeConfig.description: Contains information about the config used for the voucher code. Defines the code's pattern (prefix, postfix, length, charset, etc).

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description:
Characters that can appear in the code.  

Examples:

- Alphanumeric: `0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic Lowercase: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz` 
- Alphabetic Uppercase: `ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Numbers: `0123456789`  
- Custom: a custom character set

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

initial_count.description: Internal value, does not change anything if provided.

CustomerActivity.title: CustomerActivity
CustomerActivity.description:
This is an object representing customer activity.  

This is a general object which presents moments from customers' activity. There are all types of different events that customers perform during their journey once they participate in Promotions. Events describe moments when customers redeem coupons and earn points or rewards. The list of all types of activities is listed below.

The details describing the activity are collected in a property named `data`. In this object, software integrators will find all further information explaining the event context.

id.description: Unique event ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Event type.

data.title: CustomerActivityData
data.description: Contains details about the event. The objects that are returned in the data attribute differ based on the context of the event type.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer activity occurred in ISO 8601 format.

group_id.description: Unique identifier of the request that caused the event.

id.description: A unique identifier of an existing customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

points.description: Customer's loyalty points minus expired for all loyalty cards which the customer has.

referred_customers.description: Total number of customers referred by the customer.

campaigns.title: CustomerLoyaltyCampaigns
campaigns.description: Contains campaigns with details about point balances and how many customers were referred by the customer.

id.description: Unique redeemable holder identifier.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redeemable was assigned. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Identifier of the customer.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign identifier, assigned by Voucherify.

campaign_type.description: Defines the type of the campaign.

voucher_type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

redeemable.title: CustomerRedeemableRedeemable
redeemable.description: Detailed information about the customer's redeemable item

type.description: Type of the redeemable.

CustomerReferrals.title: CustomerReferrals
CustomerReferrals.description: Summary of customer's referrals, in this case, the customer being the referee, i.e. information about the source of referrals and number of times the customer was referred by other customers.

total.description: Total number of times this customer received a referral, i.e. was referred by another customer.

campaigns.title: CustomerReferralsCampaigns
campaigns.description: Contains an array of campaigns that served as the source of a referral for the customer.

items.title: CustomerReferralsCampaignsItem
items.description: Contains information about the source of the referral.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique referrer ID, assigned by Voucherify. This is the customer ID of a customer that is referring this customer.

related_object_id.description: Related object id

related_object_type.description: Related object type, i.e. `redemption`.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was referred in ISO 8601 format.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to redemption in this request.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

system_metadata.title: CustomerWithSummaryLoyaltyReferralsSystemMetadata
system_metadata.description: Object used to store system metadata information.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

assets.title: CustomerWithSummaryLoyaltyReferralsAssets
assets.description: Contains information about the customer's cockpit.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

email.description: Customer's email address.

phone.description: Customer's phone number. This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.title: CustomerWithSummaryLoyaltyReferralsMetadata
metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product's source ID.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the earning rule object.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

points.description: Defines how the points will be added to the loyalty card. FIXED adds a fixed number of points.

amount.title: EarningRuleLoyaltyOrderAmount
amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the calculation_type parameter. For every set of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the every parameter for the property defined in calculation_type, give the customer the number of points defined in the points parameter. In other words, for every calculation_type, give points.

every.description: Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

total_amount.title: EarningRuleLoyaltyOrderTotalAmount
total_amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the calculation_type parameter. For every set of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the every parameter for the property defined in calculation_type, give the customer the number of points defined in the points parameter. In other words, for every calculation_type, give points.

every.description: Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

metadata.title: EarningRuleLoyaltyOrderMetadata
metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the calculation_type parameter. For every given increment of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the every parameter for the property defined in calculation_type, give the customer the number of points defined in the points parameter. In other words, for every order metadata property value, give points.

every.description: For how many increments of the order metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

quantity.title: EarningRuleLoyaltyOrderItemsQuantity
quantity.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the calculation_type parameter. For every set of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the every parameter for the property defined in calculation_type, give the customer the number of points defined in the points parameter. In other words, for every calculation_type, give points.

every.description: Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 order amount is written as 1000.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

object.description: Type of object taken under consideration.

amount.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the calculation_type parameter. For every set of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the every parameter for the property defined in calculation_type, give the customer the number of points defined in the points parameter. In other words, for every calculation_type, give points.

subtotal_amount.title: EarningRuleLoyaltyOrderItemsSubtotalAmount

For every set of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the every parameter for the property defined in calculation_type, give the customer the number of points defined in the points parameter. In other words, for every calculation_type, give points.

metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the calculation_type parameter. For every given increment of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the every parameter for the property defined in calculation_type, give the customer the number of points defined in the points parameter. In other words, for every order metadata property value, give points.

every.description: For how many increments of the customer metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

metadata.title: EarningRuleLoyaltyCustomEventMetadata
metadata.description: Defines the ratio based on the property defined in the calculation_type parameter. For every given increment of value (1, 10, etc) defined in the every parameter for the property defined in calculation_type, give the customer the number of points defined in the points parameter. In other words, for every order metadata property value, give points.

every.description: For how many increments of the customer metadata property to grant points for.

points.description: Number of points to be awarded, i.e. how many points to be added to the loyalty card.

custom_event.title: EarningRuleCustomEvent
custom_event.description: Contains details about the custom event.

schema_id.description: Unique identifier of the custom event schema

segment.title: EarningRuleSegment
segment.description: Contains the ID of a customer segment. Required for the `customer.segment.entered` option in the event.

id.description: Contains a unique identifier of a customer segment. Assigned by the Voucherify API.

loyalty_tier.title: EarningRuleLoyaltyTier
loyalty_tier.description: Defines the tier associated with the earning rule definition.

id.description:
Unique loyalty tier ID associated with the earning rule.    

- `__ANY__`: any loyalty tier within the campaign

pending_points.title: EarningRulePendingPoints
pending_points.description: Defines the configuration for pending points. Pending points can be used only with the `order.paid` event.

period_type.description: Defines the type of the period during which the points are in the pending state. Currently, only `DAY` value is accepted.

period_value.description: Defines for how long the points are in the pending state. The minimum value is 1, maximum is 90.

source.title: EarningRuleSource
source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name and parent campaign.

banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

object_id.description: A unique campaign identifier assigned by the Voucherify API.

object_type.description: Defines the object associated with the earning rule. Defaults to `campaign`.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is earning_rule.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the earning rule starts to be active. Activation timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format. The earning rule is inactive before this date. If you do not define the start date for an earning rule, it will inherit the campaign start date by default.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the earning rule expires. Expiration timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format. The earning rule is inactive after this date. If you do not define the expiration date for an earning rule, it will inherit the campaign expiration date by default.

metadata.title: EarningRuleMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the earning rule. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to an earning rule object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the earning rule in a structured format.

validation_rule_id.description: A unique validation rule identifier assigned by the Voucherify API. The validation rule is verified before points are added to the balance.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the earning rule was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the earning rule on or off. You can disable an earning rule even though it's within the active period defined by the start_date and expiration_date of the campaign or the earning rule's own start_date and expiration_date.

- `true` indicates an active earning rule
- `false` indicates an inactive earning rule

EarningRuleExpirationRules.title: EarningRuleExpirationRules
EarningRuleExpirationRules.description: Defines the loyalty point expiration rule. This expiration rule applies only to this earning rule and supersedes `expiration_rules` defined in the `voucher.loyalty_card` object.

period_type.description: Type of period. Can be set for `MONTH` or `FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`. `MONTH` requires the `period_value` field. `FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR` requires the `fixed_month` and `fixed_day` fields.

period_value.description: Value of the period. Required for the `period_type: MONTH`.

rounding_type.description: Type of rounding of the expiration period. Optional for the `period_type: MONTH`.

rounding_value.description: Value of rounding of the expiration period. Required for the `rounding_type`.

fixed_month.description: Determines the month when the points expire; `1` is January, `2` is February, and so on. Required for the `period_type: FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`.

fixed_day.description: Determines the day of the month when the points expire. Required for the `period_type: FIXED_DAY_OF_YEAR`.

code.description: Error's HTTP status code.

key.description: Short string describing the kind of error which occurred.

message.description: A human-readable message providing a short description of the error.

details.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

request_id.description: This ID is useful when troubleshooting and/or finding the root cause of an error response by our support team.

resource_id.description: Unique resource ID that can be used in another endpoint to get more details.

error.title: ErrorError
error.description: Includes additional information about the error.

message.description: The message configured by the user in a validation rule.

id.description: Unique export ID.

object.description: The type of object being represented. This object stores information about the export.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the export was scheduled in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: Status of the export. Informs you whether the export has already been completed, i.e. indicates whether the file containing the exported data has been generated.

channel.description: The channel through which the export was triggered.

url.description: URL of the CSV file location. It contains the token used for authorization in the Download export method.

user_id.description: Identifies the specific user who initiated the export through the Voucherify Dashboard; returned when the channel value is WEBSITE.

fields.title: ExportParametersFields
fields.description: Array of strings containing the data in the export. These fields define the headers in the CSV file.

filters.title: ExportParametersFilters
filters.description: Allowed additional properties must start with "metadata." or "redemption." and Allowed additional properties must start with "metadata." and Allowed additional properties must start with "metadata." or "address." or "summary." or "loyalty." or "loyalty_tier." or "loyalty_points." or "system_metadata."

ExportCampaignTransactionsFilters.title: ExportCampaignTransactionsFilters
ExportCampaignTransactionsFilters.description: Data filters and their conditions to narrow down the returned data.

ExportOrderFilters.title: ExportOrderFilters
ExportOrderFilters.description: Allowed additional properties must start with "metadata."

FilterConditionsDateTime.title: FilterConditionsDateTime
FilterConditionsDateTime.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$after.description: Value is after this date. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

$before.description: Value is before this date. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$more_than.description: Value is more days ago before the current date and time, e.g. more than `10` days ago.

$less_than.description: Value is less days before the current date and time, e.g. less than `10` days ago.

FilterConditionsString.title: FilterConditionsString
FilterConditionsString.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$in.title: FilterConditionsStringIn
$in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$not_in.title: FilterConditionsStringNotIn
$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$is.description: Value is exactly this value (single value).

$has_value.description: Value is NOT null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$is_unknown.description: Value is null. The value for this parameter is an empty string.

$starts_with.description: Value starts with the specified string.

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

Gift.title: Gift
Gift.description: Contains current gift card balance information.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`. `balance` = `amount` - `subtracted_amount` - `redemption.redeemed_amount`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

data.title: InapplicableToResultListData

total.description: Total number of objects defining included products, SKUs, or product collections.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

data_ref.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

Junction.title: Junction
Junction.description: Logical Operator Between Filters. Filter by conditions set on the `junction` parameter indicating how the `conditions` should be accounted for in the query. An `AND` is an all-inclusive logical operator, meaning the `AND` operator displays a record if **ALL** the conditions separated by AND are TRUE, while  an `OR` operator displays a record if **ANY** of the conditions separated by OR is TRUE.

fields.title: LoyaltiesPointsExpirationExportCreateRequestBodyParametersFields

Array of strings containing the data that was exported. These fields define the headers in the CSV file. 

 The array can be a combination of any of the following available fields:

|:---|:---|:---|
| id | Loyalty points bucket ID. | lopb_Wl1o3EjJIHSNjvO5BDLy4z1n |
| campaign_id | Campaign ID of the parent loyalty campaign. | camp_7s3uXI44aKfIk5IhmeOPr6ic |
| voucher_id | Voucher ID of the parent loyalty card. | v_YLn0WVWXSXbUfDvxgrgUbtfJ3SQIY655 |
| status | Status of the loyalty point bucket. | `ACTIVE` or `EXPIRED` |
| expires_at | Timestamp in ISO 8601 format representing the date when the points expire. | 2022-06-30 |
| points | Number of points. | 1000 |

loyalty.title: LoyaltiesRewardsCreateAssignmentItemRequestBodyParametersLoyalty
loyalty.description: Defines the equivalent points value of the reward.

points.description: Number of points that will be subtracted from the loyalty card points balance if the reward is redeemed.

code.description: Unique loyalty card code from which the user wants to transfer loyalty points (source).

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to transfer to another loyalty card. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card (source).

source_id.description: The merchant's transaction ID if it is different from the Voucherify transaction ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a transaction ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: Always set to `true` for loyalty campaigns, meaning customers can join the campaign only once. It can't be changed to `false`.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the campaign will be active in ISO 8601 format after publishing. For example, a campaign with a `duration` of `P24D` will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.title: LoyaltyCampaignMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

category.description: Unique category name.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's voucher generation.

readonly.description: Indicates whether the campaign can be only read by a restricted user in the Areas and Stores enterprise feature. It is returned only to restricted users; this field is not returned for users with other roles.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

LoyaltyMember.description: This is an object representing a loyalty member.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique identifier of the customer who owns the voucher.

publish.title: LoyaltyMemberPublish
publish.description:
This object stores a summary of publish events: an events counter and an endpoint which can be called to return details of each event.  A publication is required for loyalty cards and referral codes. This object gets updated whenever a voucher has been published. Publication means assigning a code to a particular customer. Typically, a publication is made by distributing your codes to your customers, e.g. through Export to MailChimp or <!-- [publish voucher](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1publications/post) -->[publish voucher](ref:create-publication) API method. 

<!-- title: My Table Title -->

| Required | Optional |
| -------- | :------: |
| `type`:`LOYALTY_CARD` |  `type`:`DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`   | 
| `is_referral_code`:`true`      |    `type`:`GIFT_VOUCHER`   |

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the loyalty tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Loyalty tier is inactive before this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the loyalty tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Loyalty tier is inactive after this date.

qualification_type.description:
Tier qualification.   

`BALANCE`: Points balance is based on the customer's current points balance. Customers qualify for the tier if their points balance is in the points range of the tier. 
 `POINTS_IN_PERIOD`: A customer qualifies for the tier only if the sum of the accumulated points in a **defined time interval** reaches the tier threshold.

qualification_period.description:
Customers can qualify for the tier if they collected enough points in a given time period. So, in addition to the customer having to reach a points range, they also need to have collected the points within a set time period. | **Period** | **Definition** | |:---|:---| | **Calendar Month** | Points collected in one calendar month
January, February, March, etc. | | **Calendar Quarter** | Points collected in the quarter
- January - March
- April - June
- July - September
- October - December | | **Calendar Half-year** | Points collected in the half-year
- January - June
- July - December | | **Calendar Year** | Points collected in one calendar year
January - December |

start_date.title: LoyaltyTiersExpirationAllStartDate
start_date.description: Defines the conditions for the start date of the tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to be valid for a customer.    
`IMMEDIATE`: After reaching the minimum required points. 
`NEXT_PERIOD`: When the next qualification period starts.

expiration_date.title: LoyaltyTiersExpirationAllExpirationDate
expiration_date.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.    
`END_OF_PERIOD`: Expire tier at the end of the period.    
`END_OF_NEXT_PERIOD`:  Expire tier at the end of the next period. 
 `BALANCE_DROP`: Tier expires when the points balance drops below the required range of the tier. 
 `CUSTOM`: Tier expires after a certain time period passes following the instance the points balance drops below the required range of the tier.

extend.description: Extend the expiration by adding extra months or days in ISO 8601 format. The tier will remain active even though it reaches its expiration time period. For example, a tier with a duration of `P3M` will be valid for an additional duration of 3 months and a tier with a duration of `P1D` will be valid for an additional duration of 1 day.

rounding.description: Defines the rounding mechanism for tier expiration.

type.description: This mechanism describes a custom rounding for the expiration date.

strategy.description: This mechanism describes a rounding strategy for the expiration date.

unit.description: Defines the type of unit of time in which the rounding period is counted.

value.description:
Value for the unit of time that the rounding applies to. Units for this parameter are defined by the `rounding.unit` parameter.    
- `0`: January
- `1`: February
- `2`: March
- `3`: April
- `4`: May
- `5`: June
- `6`: July
- `7`: August
- `8`: September
- `9`: October
- `10`: November
- `11`: December

id.description: Unique identifier of the project.

description.description: A user-defined description of the project, e.g. its purpose, scope, region.

timezone.description: The time zone in which the project is established. It can be in the GMT format or in accordance with IANA time zone database.

currency.description: The currency used in the project. It is equal to a 3-letter ISO 4217 code.

dial_code.description: The country dial code for the project. It is equal to an ITU country code.

webhook_version.description: The webhook version used in the project.

client_set_voucher_expiration_date_enabl.description: Enables client-side setting of voucher expiration date.

email.description: Enables the notification through an email.

in_app.description: Enables the notification through an email.

emails.description: An array of email addresses which will receive the notification.

case_sensitive_codes.description:
Determines if the vouchers in the project will be:
- case sensitive - if `true`, `C0dE-cfV` is **not** equal to `c0de-cfv`),
- case insensitive - if `false`, `C0dE-cfV` is equal to `c0de-cfv`.

api_version.description: The API version used in the project. Currently, the default and only value is `v2018-08-01`.

is_sandbox.description: Determines if the project is a sandbox project.

default_code_config.title: ManagementProjectDefaultCodeConfig
default_code_config.description: Determines the character set that is used as default for vouchers. It is affected by the `"case_sensitive_codes"` setting.

charset.description: Lists all characters that are used as default for vouchers

limits.title: ManagementProjectLimits
limits.description: Determines additional limits set on a given project, e.g. the Sandbox project. If no limits are returned, the limits set for the whole organization apply.

items.title: ManagementProjectLimitsApiCallsItem
items.description: Determines the limit of API calls per given unit time.

value.description: Determines the maximum number of API calls per time set in `"duration"`.

duration.description: Determines the amount of time during which the calls up to the number specified in the `value` can be made. The duration is presented in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. `PT1H` means one hour.

value.description: Determines the maximum number of API calls per time set in `"duration"`.

duration.description: Determines the amount of time during which the calls up to the number specified in the `value` can be made. The duration is presented in the ISO 8601 format, e.g. `PT1H` means one hour.

id.description: Unique identifier of the brand configuration.

privacy_policy_url.description: Defines the URL to the brand's privacy policy. It must be a valid URL format.

permission_reminder.description: Defines the message that is displayed to customers who opted in an email newsletter.

website_url.description: Defines the URL to the brand's website. It must be a valid URL format.

state.description: Defines the brand's state or similar administrative area.

email.description: Defines the brand's email address. It must be a valid email format.
