loyalty_enabled.description: Enables the loyalty campaign overview for customers.

gift_cards_enabled.description: Enables the gift card overview for customers.

coupons_enabled.description: Enables the discount coupon overview for customers.

referrals_enabled.description: Enables the referral campaign overview for customers.

theme.description: Determines the color scheme of the customer cockpit.

use_custom_double_opt_in_redirect_url.description: Enables the double opt-in option. It must be a valid URL format.

custom_double_opt_in_redirect_url.description: Defines the URL for the double opt-in consent. It must be a valid URL format.

ManagementProjectsCustomEventSchema.title: ManagementProjectsCustomEventSchema

id.description: Unique identifier of the custom event schema.

name.description: User-defined name of the custom event. This is also shown in **Project Settings** > **Event Schema** in the Voucherify Dashboard.

schema.title: ManagementProjectsCustomEventSchemaSchema
schema.description: Object containing custom event schema and its custom attributes (metadata).

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the custom event schema was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the custom event schema was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

ManagementProjectsCustomEventSchema.description: Object containing the response to creating a custom event schema.

id.description: Unique identifier of the metadata schema.

related_object.description: The resource type. You can define custom metadata schemas, which have a custom `"related_object"` resource type. The standard metadata schemas are: `"campaign"`, `"customer"`, `"earning_rule"`, `"loyalty_tier"`, `"order"`, `"order_item"`, `"product"`, `"promotion_tier"`, `"publication"`, `"redemption"`, `"reward"`, `"voucher"`.

allow_defined_only.description: Restricts the creation of metadata fields when set to `true`. It indicates whether or not you can create new metadata definitions, e.g. in the campaign or publication manager. If set to `true`, then only the defined fields are available for assigning values.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the metadata schema was created. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the metadata schema was updated. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the metadata schema.

ManagementProjectsStackingRules.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRules

id.description: The unique identifier of the stacking rules.

exclusive_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesExclusiveCategories
exclusive_categories.description: Lists the IDs of exclusive categories. A redeemable from a campaign with an exclusive category is the only redeemable to be redeemed when applied with redeemables from other campaigns unless these campaigns are exclusive or joint.

joint_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesJointCategories
joint_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the joint categories. A campaign with a joint category is always applied regardless of the exclusivity of other campaigns.

redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables can be sent in one request. Note: more redeemables means more processing time.

applicable_redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables can be applied in one request. The number must be less than or equal to `redeemables_limit`. For example, a user can select 30 discounts but only 5 will be applied to the order and the remaining will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_redeemables_per_category_limi.description: Defines how many redeemables with the same category can be applied in one request. The number must be less than or equal to `applicable_redeemables_limit`. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables with an assigned exclusive category can be applied in one request. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_exclusive_redeemables_per_cat.description: Defines how many redeemables with an assigned exclusive category can be applied in one request. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`. The number must be less than or equal to `applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit`.

discount_calculation_mode.description: Defines if the discounts are applied by taking into account the initial order amount or the discounted order amount.

initial_amount_mode_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesInitialAmountModeCategories
initial_amount_mode_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the categories that apply a discount based on the initial amount.

discounted_amount_mode_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesDiscountedAmountModeCategories
discounted_amount_mode_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the categories that apply a discount based on the discounted amount.

redeemables_application_mode.description:
Defines the application mode for redeemables.
`"ALL"` means that all redeemables must be validated for the redemption to be successful.
`"PARTIAL"` means that only those redeemables that can be validated will be redeemed. The redeemables that fail validaton will be skipped.

redeemables_sorting_rule.description: Defines redeemables sorting rule. `CATEGORY_HIERARCHY` means that redeemables are applied oaccording to the category priority. `REQUESTED_ORDER` means that redeemables are applied in the sequence provided in the request.

redeemables_products_application_mode.description: Defines redeemables products application mode. `STACK` means that multiple discounts can be applied to a product. `ONCE` means that only one discount can be applied to the same product.

redeemables_no_effect_rule.description: Defines redeemables no effect rule. `REDEEM_ANYWAY` means that the redeemable will be redeemed regardless of any restrictions or conditions in place. `SKIP` means that the redeemable will be processed only when an applicable effect is calculated.

no_effect_skip_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesNoEffectSkipCategories
no_effect_skip_categories.description: Lists category IDs. Redeemables with a given category are skipped even if the `redeemables_no_effect_rule` is set to `REDEEM_ANYWAY`. Category IDs can't overlap with the IDs in `no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories`.

no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories.title: ManagementProjectsStackingRulesNoEffectRedeemAnywayCategories
no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories.description: Lists category IDs. Redeemables with a given category are redeemed anyway even if the `redeemables_no_effect_rule` is set to `SKIP`. Category IDs can't overlap with the IDs in `no_effect_skip_categories`.

redeemables_rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the stacking rules were created. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the stacking rules were updated. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

ManagementProjectsStackingRules.description: Object representing the details of the stacking rules.

ManagementProjectsWebhook.title: ManagementProjectsWebhook

id.description: Unique identifier of the webhook.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the webhook configuration was created. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

events.title: ManagementProjectsWebhookEvents
events.description: Lists the events that trigger webhook sendout.

active.description: Determines if the webhook configuration is active.

ManagementProjectsWebhook.description: Response body schema for webhook endpoints.

MemberActivity.title: MemberActivity
MemberActivity.description:
This is an object representing member activity.  

This is a general object which presents moments from members' activity. There are all types of different events that members perform during their journey once they participate in a loyalty program. Events describe moments when the members redeem loyalty cards and earn points or rewards. The list of all types of activities is listed below.

The details describing the activity are collected in an array property named `data`. In this object, software integrators can find all further information explaining the event context.

id.description: Unique event ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Event type.

data.title: MemberActivityData
data.description: Contains details about the event. The objects that are returned in the data attribute differ based on the context of the event type.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the member activity occurred in ISO 8601 format.

group_id.description: Unique identifier of the request that caused the event.

id.description: Unique identifier of the metadata schema.

related_object.description: The resource type. You can define custom metadata schemas, which have a custom `"related_object"` resource type. The standard metadata schemas are: `"campaign"`, `"customer"`, `"earning_rule"`, `"loyalty_tier"`, `"order"`, `"order_item"`, `"product"`, `"promotion_tier"`, `"publication"`, `"redemption"`, `"reward"`, `"voucher"`.

allow_defined_only.description: Restricts the creation of metadata fields when set to `true`. It indicates whether or not you can create new metadata definitions, e.g. in the campaign or publication manager. If set to `true`, then only the defined fields are available for assigning values.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the metadata schema was created. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the metadata schema was updated. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the metadata schema.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items.title: OrderItems
items.description: Array of items applied to the order. It can include up to 500 items.

metadata.title: OrderMetadata
metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format. It can be used to define business validation rules or discount formulas.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

initial_amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts before any discount or other effect (e.g. add missing units) is applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_amount.description: Order amount after undoing all the discounts through the rollback redemption. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

metadata.title: OrderCalculatedMetadata
metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format. It can be used to define business validation rules or discount formulas.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the customer making the purchase. The ID is assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique referrer ID.

items.title: OrderCalculatedItems
items.description: Array of items applied to the order. It can include up 500 items.

id.description: Unique identifier of the order line item.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product. It is assigned by Voucherify.

related_object.description: Used along with the source_id property, can be set to either sku or product.

source_id.description: The merchant's product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is useful in the integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database, or a third-party service.

quantity.description: The quantity of the particular item in the cart.

initial_quantity.description: A positive integer in the smallest unit quantity representing the total amount of the order; this is the sum of the order items' quantity.

amount.description: The total amount of the order item (price * quantity).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-item-level discounts applied to the order.

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

applied_discount_quantity.description: Number of the discounted items applied in the transaction.

applied_quantity.description: Quantity of items changed by the application of a new quantity items. It can be positive when an item is added or negative if an item is replaced.

applied_quantity_amount.description: Amount for the items changed by the application of a new quantity items. It can be positive when an item is added or negative if an item is replaced.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

price.description: Unit price of an item. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`applied_discount_amount`

product.title: OrderCalculatedItemProduct
product.description: An object containing details of the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's product ID (if it is different than Voucherify's product ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system.

It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format. It can be used to create product collections.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the product was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the product.

Product.description:
This is an object representing a product.  

This entity should be used to map product items from your inventory management system. The aim of products is to build which reflect product-specific campaigns.

PromotionTier.title: PromotionTier
PromotionTier.description: This is an object representing a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are always assigned to a campaign and cannot be used standalone.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

action.title: PromotionTierAction
action.description: Contains details about the discount applied by the promotion tier.

metadata.title: PromotionTierMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

campaign.title: PromotionTierCampaign
campaign.description: Contains details about promotion tier's parent campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` using the <!-- [Disable Campaign](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1campaigns~1{campaignId}~1disable) -->[Disable Campaign](ref:disable-campaign) endpoint.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

campaign_id.description: Promotion tier's parent campaign's unique ID.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

summary.title: PromotionTierSummary
summary.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions and orders.

redemptions.title: PromotionTierSummaryRedemptions
redemptions.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions.

total_redeemed.description: Number of times the promotion tier was redeemed.

orders.title: PromotionTierSummaryOrders
orders.description: Contains statistics about orders related to the promotion tier.

total_amount.description: Sum of order totals.

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of total discount applied using the promotion tier.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

category_id.description: Promotion tier category ID.

PromotionTierCreateParams.title: PromotionTierCreateParams
PromotionTierCreateParams.description: This is an object representing a promotion tier create params. Promotion tiers are always assigned to a campaign and cannot be used standalone.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

action.title: PromotionTierCreateParamsAction
action.description: Contains details about the discount applied by the promotion tier.

metadata.title: PromotionTierCreateParamsMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

validation_rules.description: Array containing the ID of the validation rule associated with the promotion tier.

A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

category.description: Assign category to the promotion tier.

category_id.description: Instead of using the category name, you can alternatively assign a new category to a promotion tier using a unique category ID, i.e. `cat_0c9da30e7116ba6bba`.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about promotion tiers in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of promotion tier objects.

tiers.title: PromotionTiersListTiers
tiers.description: Contains array of promotion tier objects.

total.description: Total number of promotion tiers.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates if there are more records for given filter parameters. This lets you know if you can run another request to get more records returned in the results.

QualificationsOption.title: QualificationsOption
QualificationsOption.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

limit.description: The maximum number of redeemables to be returned in the API request. The actual number of returned redeemables will be determined by the API. The default value is set to 5

filters.title: QualificationsOptionFilters
filters.description: A set of filters to return only a specific category or type of redeemable.

campaign_type.title: QualificationsOptionFiltersCampaignType
campaign_type.description: Returns both campaigns and their vouchers or promotion tiers. Use other filters, e.g. `resource_type`, to narrow down the results.

conditions.title: QualificationsOptionFiltersCampaignTypeConditions
conditions.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

conditions.title: QualificationsOptionFiltersResourceTypeConditions
QualificationsOptionFiltersHolderRoleConditions
conditions.description: Data filters used to narrow down the data records to be returned in the result.

$is.title: QualificationsOptionFiltersHolderRoleConditionsIs

$is_not.title: QualificationsOptionFiltersHolderRoleConditionsIsNot
$is_not.description: Will return records only for the first value in the array.

$in.title: QualificationsOptionFiltersHolderRoleConditionsIn
$in.description: Will return records for the values in the array.

$not_in.title: QualificationsOptionFiltersHolderRoleConditionsNotIn
$not_in.description: Will return records for the values in the array.

expand.title: QualificationsOptionExpand
expand.description:
The expand array lets you configure the parameters included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. | **Expand Option** | **Response Body** | |:---|:---| | [`"redeemable"`] | Returns the redeemables':
- metadata
- redeemable name,
- campaign name,
- campaign ID| | [`"category"`] | - Returns an expanded `categories` object, showing details about the category. | | [`"validation_rules"`] | - Returns an expanded `validation_rules` object, showing details about the validation rules. |

sorting_rule.description:
Is used to determine the order in which data is displayed in the result array. 

 - `DEFAULT` - Sorting descending by `created_at` 
 - `BEST_DEAL` - Sorting descending by `total_applied_discount_amount` 
 - `LEAST_DEAL` - Sorting ascending by `total_applied_discount_amount`

total.description: The number of redeemables returned in the API request.

has_more.description: As results are always limited, the `has_more` flag indicates if there are more records for given parameters. This lets you know if you can run another request (with different options) to get more records returned in the results.

more_starting_after.description: Timestamp representing the date and time to use in `starting_after` cursor to get more redeemables.

customer_id.description: Unique identifier of the customer.

campaign_id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign as assigned by Voucherify.

campaign_type.description: Defines the type of the campaign.

voucher_type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a redeemable holder. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the `redeemable_holder` object.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.title: RedemptionMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the redemption.

amount.description:
For gift cards, this is a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the number of redeemed credits.
For loyalty cards, this is the number of loyalty points used in the transaction.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption.

session.title: RedemptionSession
session.description: Contains details about the redemption session lock. Sessions can be established only for discount vouchers, promotions, and gift cards.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID sent in the request.

id.description: Unique rollback redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values. This is returned only in GET `v1/redemptions/` and GET `v1/redemptions/{redemptionId}` endpoints.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a more expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

channel.title: RedemptionChannel
channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API. For `AUTO_REDEEM`, it is the reward assignment ID.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard, `API` corresponds to the API, and `AUTO_REDEEM` corresponds to a loyalty campaign reward that has been redeemed automatically.

related_object_type.description: Defines the related object.

related_object_id.description: Unique related object ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno for a voucher.

gift.title: RedemptionGift
gift.description: Contains the amount subtracted from the gift card for the redemption.

amount.description: Amount subtracted from the gift card as a result of the redemption. The amount is expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

loyalty_card.title: RedemptionLoyaltyCard
loyalty_card.description: Contains the number of points subtracted from the loyalty card for the redemption.

points.description: Number of points subtracted from the loyalty card as a result of the redemption.

voucher.title: RedemptionVoucher
voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.title: RedemptionVoucherGift
gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.title: RedemptionVoucherLoyaltyCard
loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the redeemable holder. It equals to the customer ID assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referring person.

publish.description: Stores a summary of publication events: an event counter and endpoint to return details of each event. Publication is an assignment of a code to a customer, e.g. through a distribution.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

Redemption.description: This is an object representing a redemption for **POST** `v1/redemptions` and **POST** `/client/v1/redemptions`.

metadata.title: RedemptionEntryMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the redemption.

amount.description:
For gift cards, this is a positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the number of redeemed credits.
For loyalty cards, this is the number of loyalty points used in the transaction. and For gift cards, this represents the number of the credits restored to the card in the rolledback redemption. The number is a negative integer in the smallest currency unit, e.g. -100 cents for $1.00 added back to the card.
For loyalty cards, this represents the number of loyalty points restored to the card in the rolledback redemption. The number is a negative integer.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption.

session.title: RedemptionEntrySession
session.description: Contains details about the redemption session lock. Sessions can be established only for discount vouchers, promotions, and gift cards.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID sent in the request.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values. This is returned only in GET `v1/redemptions/` and GET `v1/redemptions/{redemptionId}` endpoints.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a more expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

initial_amount.description: This is the sum of the order items' amounts before any discount or other effect (e.g. add missing units) is applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

total_amount.description: Order amount after undoing all the discounts through the rollback redemption. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request. It is expressed as an integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

amount.description: Amount returned to the gift card as a result of the redemption rollback and expressed as a negative integer. The amount is expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. -100 cents for $1.00 returned).

loyalty_card.title: RedemptionRollbackLoyaltyCard
loyalty_card.description: Contains the number of points returned to the loyalty card in the reward redemption rollback. It is expressed as a negative integer.

points.description: Number of points being returned to the loyalty card for the reward redemption rollback. It is expressed as a negative integer.

id.description: Unique identifier of the redemption rollback.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

ReferralProgram.title: ReferralProgram
ReferralProgram.description: Defines the referee reward and the way a referral is triggered. Context: `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

conversion_event_type.description: Define how a referral is triggered.

custom_event.title: ReferralProgramCustomEvent
custom_event.description: Contains details about the custom event.

id.description: Unique custom event ID.

related_object_parent.title: ReferralProgramRefereeRewardRelatedObjectParent
related_object_parent.description: Details of the resource from which the reward originates.

id.description: Unique ID of the reward source.

object.description: Type of resource represented by the source of the reward.

type.description: Type of reward.

amount.description: Define the number of `points` to add to a loyalty card or `credits` to the balance on a gift card. In case of the gift card, the value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

email.description: Customer's email address.

phone.description: Customer's phone number. This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.title: ReferrerMetadata
metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

id.description: A unique identifier of an existing customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: Unique reward assignment ID, assigned by Voucherify.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward assignment was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward assignment was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the reward assignment.

related_object_id.description: Related object ID to which the reward was assigned.

related_object_type.description: Related object type to which the reward was assigned.

parameters.title: RewardAssignmentParameters
parameters.description: Defines the cost of the reward.

loyalty.title: RewardAssignmentParametersLoyalty
loyalty.description: Defines the equivalent points value of the reward.

points.description: The number of points required to redeem the reward.

auto_redeem.description: Determines if the reward is redeemed automatically when the customer reaches the sufficient number of points to redeem it. Value `true` means that the automatic reward redemption is active. Only one reward can be set to be redeemed automatically in a loyalty campaign, i.e. only one can have the value `true`.

campaign.title: RewardTypeCampaign
campaign.description: Objects stores information about the campaign related to the reward.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

balance.description:
The number of points to be added to a loyalty card or the amount to be added to the current balance on the gift card.

For gift cards, the value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

type.description: Campaign type.

coin.title: RewardTypeCoin
coin.description: Defines the ratio by mapping the number of loyalty points in points_ratio to a predefined cash amount in exchange_ratio.

exchange_ratio.description: The cash equivalent of the points defined in the points_ratio property.

points_ratio.description: The number of loyalty points that will map to the predefined cash amount defined by the exchange_ratio property.

product.title: RewardTypeProduct
product.description: Contains information about the product given as a reward.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify, of the SKU given as a reward.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

type.description: This parameter is required to establish a new session.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the session.ttl_unit parameter.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

id.description: Unique identifier of an existing customer. It is assigned by Voucherify.

email.description: Customer's email address.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service.

metadata.title: SimpleCustomerMetadata
metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that are attached to the customer. It stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

SimpleCustomerRequiredObjectType.title: SimpleCustomerRequiredObjectType
SimpleCustomerRequiredObjectType.description: This is an object representing a customer with limited properties used in Event Tracking endpoints.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

email.description: Customer's email address.

metadata.title: SimpleCustomerRequiredObjectTypeMetadata
metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the customer.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

id.description: Unique segment ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the ID.

id.description: Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product variant's source ID.

Sku.title: Sku
Sku.description: This is an object representing a product SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price. It is represented by a value multiplied by 100 to accurately reflect 2 decimal places, such as `$100.00` being expressed as `10000`.

attributes.title: SkuAttributes
attributes.description: The attributes object stores values for all custom attributes inherited by the SKU from the parent product. A set of key/value pairs that are attached to a SKU object and are unique to each SKU within a product family.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file that will be used to render the SKU image.

metadata.title: SkuMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the SKU. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a SKU object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the SKU in a structured format. It can be used to create product collections.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the SKU was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the SKU was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `SKU`.
The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about SKUs.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the JSON property that contains the array of SKUs.

data.title: SkusListForProductData
data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of SKUs.

total.description: Total number of SKUs in the product.

StackingRules.title: StackingRules
StackingRules.description: Defines stacking rules for redeemables. Read more in the [Stacking Rule Documentation](https://support.voucherify.io/article/604-stacking-rules).

redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables can be sent in one request. Note: more redeemables means more processing time.

applicable_redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables can be applied in one request. The number must be less than or equal to `redeemables_limit`. For example, a user can select 30 discounts but only 5 will be applied to the order and the remaining will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_redeemables_per_category_limi.description: Defines how many redeemables with the same category can be applied in one request. The number must be less than or equal to `applicable_redeemables_limit`. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_exclusive_redeemables_limit.description: Defines how many redeemables with an assigned exclusive category can be applied in one request. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

applicable_exclusive_redeemables_per_cat.description: Defines how many redeemables with an exclusive category per category in stacking rules can be applied in one request. The ones above the limit will be `SKIPPED` according to the `redeemables_sorting_rule`.

exclusive_categories.title: StackingRulesExclusiveCategories
exclusive_categories.description: Lists the IDs of exclusive categories. A redeemable from a campaign with an exclusive category is the only redeemable to be redeemed when applied with redeemables from other campaigns unless these campaigns are exclusive or joint.

joint_categories.title: StackingRulesJointCategories
joint_categories.description: Lists the IDs of the joint categories. A campaign with a joint category is always applied regardless of the exclusivity of other campaigns.

redeemables_application_mode.description:
Defines the application mode for redeemables.
`"ALL"` means that all redeemables must be validated for the redemption to be successful.
`"PARTIAL"` means that only those redeemables that can be validated will be redeemed. The redeemables that fail validaton will be skipped.

redeemables_sorting_rule.description: Defines redeemables sorting rule. `CATEGORY_HIERARCHY` means that redeemables are applied oaccording to the category priority. `REQUESTED_ORDER` means that redeemables are applied in the sequence provided in the request.

redeemables_products_application_mode.description: Defines redeemables products application mode. `STACK` means that multiple discounts can be applied to a product. `ONCE` means that only one discount can be applied to the same product.

redeemables_no_effect_rule.description: Defines redeemables no effect rule. `REDEEM_ANYWAY` means that the redeemable will be redeemed regardless of any restrictions or conditions in place. `SKIP` means that the redeemable will be processed only when an applicable effect is calculated.

no_effect_skip_categories.title: StackingRulesNoEffectSkipCategories
no_effect_skip_categories.description: Lists category IDs. Redeemables with a given category are skipped even if the `redeemables_no_effect_rule` is set to `REDEEM_ANYWAY`. Category IDs can't overlap with the IDs in `no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories`.

no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories.title: StackingRulesNoEffectRedeemAnywayCategories
no_effect_redeem_anyway_categories.description: Lists category IDs. Redeemables with a given category are redeemed anyway even if the `redeemables_no_effect_rule` is set to `SKIP`. Category IDs can't overlap with the IDs in `no_effect_skip_categories`.

redeemables_rollback_order_mode.description: Defines the rollback mode for the order. `WITH_ORDER` is a default setting. The redemption is rolled back together with the data about the order, including related discount values. `WITHOUT_ORDER` allows rolling the redemption back without affecting order data, including the applied discount values.

TrashBinItem.title: TrashBinItem
TrashBinItem.description: Resource moved to the bin, i.e. a campaign, product, SKU, or voucher.

id.description: Unique identifier of the trash bin entry. It should not be confused with the ID of the resource moved to the bin.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the resource was moved to the bin. The value for this parameter is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

deleted_by_user_id.description: Unique identifier of the user who moved the resource to the bin. It returns a user ID if the resource was moved to the bin through an action in the website. It returns a `null` if the resource was deleted through the API.

resource_id.description: Unique identifier of the resource moved to the bin, i.e. an ID of a campaign, product, SKU, or voucher.

resource_type.description: Type of the resource moved to the bin.

resource_name.description: Name of the resouce moved to the bin. It is the name of the campaign, product or SKU, or the voucher code.

resource_parent_id.description: Unique identifier of the parent resource. For a voucher, it is a campaign ID, except for generic (standalone) voucherss. For an SKU, it is the product ID. It returns `null` for campaigns and base products.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. It is equal to the `resource_type`.

value.description: The percent value of the limit which, when reached, triggers the notification.

in_app.description: Enables the notification in the application.

emails.title: UsageNotificationsEmails
emails.description: An array of email addresses which will receive the notification.

id.description: The unique identifier of the user who has been assigned to the project.

login.description: The login data of the user who has been assigned to the project.

email.description: The email address of the user who has been assigned to the project.

first_name.description: The first name of the user who has been assigned to the project.

last_name.description: The last name of the user who has been assigned to the project.

projects.title: UserProjects
projects.description: Lists key-value pairs, where the key is the project to which the user is assigned. The value is the role assigned in a given project. The predefined Voucherify roles are: `ADMIN`, `USER`, `VIEWER`, `MERCHANT`, `USER_RESTRICTED` (for the Areas and Stores, an Enterprise feature).

is_owner.description: Determines if the user is the owner for the organization in Voucherify.

name.description: Custom, unique name for set of validation rules.

error.title: ValidationRuleError
error.description: Contains the error message returned from API when validation / redemption fails to meet requirements of defined rules.

message.description: The error message returned from API when validation / redemption fails to meet requirements of defined rules.

excluded.title: ValidationRuleApplicableToExcluded
excluded.description: Defines which items are excluded from a discount.

included.title: ValidationRuleApplicableToIncluded
included.description: Defines which items are included in a discount.

included_all.description: Indicates whether all items are included in the discount.

type.description: Type of validation rule.

ValidationRuleBundleRules.title: ValidationRuleBundleRules
ValidationRuleBundleRules.description:
Contains all the definitions for the bundle rules. It is a set of key value pairs representing the rules and logic between them. The keys are numbered consecutively beginning from `1`. The values are objects containing the rule conditions.

While updating with the PUT method, you can pass `"bundle_rules": null` to delete the configuration; in the response, an empty object is then returned.

ValidationRuleRules.title: ValidationRuleRules
ValidationRuleRules.description: Contains all the rule definitions for the validation rule. It is a set of key value pairs representing the rules and logic between the rules. The keys are numbered consecutively beginning from `1`. The values are objects containing the rule conditions.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID assigned by Voucherify. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

name.description: Name of the promotion tier. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID assigned by Voucherify. Displayed only if the `options.expand` is passed with a `redeemable` value in the validation request body.

ValidityDayOfWeek.title: ValidityDayOfWeek
ValidityDayOfWeek.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the voucher is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3` Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

ValidityHours.title: ValidityHours
ValidityHours.description: Determines the hours of validity, e.g. to create a happy hours scenario.

daily.title: ValidityHoursDaily
daily.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource is active. The periods should not overlap.

items.title: ValidityHoursDailyItem
items.description: Defines the reccuring period(s) when the resource will be active.

start_time.description: Defines the starting hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive before* this time.

days_of_week.title: ValidityHoursDailyItemDaysOfWeek
days_of_week.description:
Integer array corresponding to the particular days of the week in which the resource is valid.

- `0` Sunday
- `1` Monday
- `2` Tuesday
- `3`  Wednesday
- `4` Thursday
- `5` Friday
- `6` Saturday

expiration_time.description: Defines the ending hour of validity in the HH:mm format. The resource is *inactive after* this time.

ValidityTimeframe.title: ValidityTimeframe
ValidityTimeframe.description: Set recurrent time periods when the earning rule is valid. For example, valid for 1 hour every other day.`start_date` **required** when including the `validity_timeframe`.

duration.description: Defines the amount of time an earning rule will be active in ISO 8601 format. For example, an earning rule with a `duration` of `PT1H` will be valid for a duration of one hour.

interval.description: Defines the intervening time between two time points in ISO 8601 format, expressed as a duration. For example, an earning rule with an `interval` of `P2D` will be valid every other day.

Voucher.title: Voucher

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.title: VoucherGift
gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtracted_amount.description: Total amount of subtracted credits over the gift card lifetime. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

balance.description: Available funds. The value is multiplied by 100 to represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.title: VoucherLoyaltyCard
loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total number of points added to the loyalty card over its lifespan.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption. This is calculated as follows: `balance` = `points` - `expired_points` - `subtracted_points` - `redemption.redeemed_points`.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

pending_points.description: Shows the number of pending points that will be added to the loyalty card when they are activated automatically or manually.

expired_points.description: Shows the total number of expired points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

subtracted_points.description: Shows the total number of subtracted points over the lifetime of the loyalty card.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.title: VoucherMetadata
metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the redeemable holder. It equals to the customer ID assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referring person.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

publish.title: VoucherPublish
publish.description: Stores a summary of publication events: an event counter and endpoint to return details of each event. Publication is an assignment of a code to a customer, e.g. through a distribution.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

redemption.title: VoucherRedemption
redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a **GET** method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

Voucher.description: This is an object representing a voucher with categories and validation rules assignments.

VoucherAssets.title: VoucherAssets
VoucherAssets.description: Stores links to images of QR and barcode that correspond to an encrypted voucher code.

qr.title: VoucherAssetsQr
qr.description: Stores Quick Response (QR) representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to QR code  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

barcode.title: VoucherAssetsBarcode
barcode.description: Stores barcode representation of encrypted code.

id.description: Encrypted voucher code ID.

url.description:
URL to barcode  

*Optional:* Attach query parameters to base URL to customize the image of the encrypted voucher code.  

- `size`: integer value from `1` to `100`  
- `format`: string, either `png` (default) or `svg`

id.description: Unique transaction ID.

source_id.description: The merchant's transaction ID if it is different from the Voucherify transaction ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a transaction ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service. In case of a redemption, this value is null.

campaign_id.description: Unqiue campaign ID of the voucher's parent campaign if it is part of campaign that generates bulk codes.

source.description: The channel through which the transaction took place, whether through the API or the the Dashboard. In case of a redemption, this value is null.

reason.description: Reason why the transaction occurred. In case of a redemption, this value is null.

related_transaction_id.description: The related transaction ID on the receiving card.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the transaction was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

details.title: VoucherTransactionDetails
details.description: Contains the detailed information about the transaction.

balance.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsBalance
balance.description: Contains information on how the balance was affected by the transaction.

type.description: The type of voucher whose balance is being adjusted due to the transaction.

total.description: The number of all points or credits accumulated on the card as affected by add or subtract operations.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON.

points.description: Points added or subtracted in the transaction of a loyalty card.

balance.description: The available points or credits on the card after the transaction as affected by redemption or rollback.

operation_type.description: The type of the operation being performed. The operation type is `AUTOMATIC` if it is an automatic redemption.

related_object.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsBalanceRelatedObject
related_object.description: Defines the resource that is being modified with the values that are returned in the balance object.

id.description: Identifies the voucher that is being modified. The ID is assigned by the Voucherify API.

type.description: The object being modified, i.e. voucher.

order.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsOrder
order.description: Contains information about the original order.

id.description: Unique order ID.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

event.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsEvent
event.description: Contains information about the event that triggers the point accrual.

id.description: Unique event ID.

type.description: Type of event.

earning_rule.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsEarningRule
earning_rule.description: Contains information about the earning rule.

id.description: Unique identifier of an earning rule, assigned by Voucherify.

source.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsEarningRuleSource
source.description: Contains the custom earning rule name.

banner.description: Name of the earning rule. This is displayed as a header for the earning rule in the Dashboard.

id.description: Unique identifier of the segment.

loyalty_tier.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsLoyaltyTier
loyalty_tier.description: Contains information about the loyalty tier that is mapped for the earning rule and used in the transaction.

id.description: Unique identifier of the loyalty tier, assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the loyalty tier.

redemption.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsRedemption
redemption.description: Contains information about the original redemption.

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

rollback.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsRollback
rollback.description: Contains information about the redemption rollback.

id.description: Unique identifier of the redemption rollback.

custom_event.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsCustomEvent
custom_event.description: Contains information about the custom event that triggers the point accrual.

id.description: Unique identifier of the event.

type.description: Type of the custom event.

event_schema.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsEventSchema
event_schema.description: Contains information about the custom event metadata schema.

id.description: Unique identifier of the metadata schema.

holder_loyalty_tier.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsHolderLoyaltyTier
holder_loyalty_tier.description: Loyalty tier of the loyalty card holder at the moment when the transaction occurred. The loyalty tier is the tier in which the holder was before the loyalty point balance changed.

id.description: Unique identifier of the loyalty tier, assigned by Voucherify.

name.description: User-defined name of the loyalty tier.

reward.title: VoucherTransactionDetailsReward
reward.description: Contains information about the pay with points reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID.
